title: Sell Duncan Taylor Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Duncan Taylor Whisky | The Octave & Rarest of the Rare | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your Duncan Taylor whisky. We buy The Octave, Rarest of the Rare, Peerless, and NC2 ranges.
heroSubhead: Direct buyer for The Octave, Rarest of the Rare, and Peerless.
introParagraph: Duncan Taylor owns one of the largest private collections of aged Scotch casks. Their 'Rarest of the Rare' and 'Peerless' collections from the early 2000s are legendary.
whatWeBuy: Duncan Taylor Rarest of the Rare
Duncan Taylor Black Bull (30/40 Year Old)
photoChecklist: Front label showing Series and Vintage
conditionFactors: Series Identification: 'Peerless' bottles are often tall and elegant. 'Rarest of the Rare' has specific branding.
Octave Boxes: Check the condition of the small box.
Fill Level: Very important for the Peerless range (early 2000s bottling).
Label: Tantalus bottles come in wooden frames; checks for frame damage.
pricingFactors: Closed Distilleries: Duncan Taylor bottled a lot of Caperdonich, Imperial, and Glenugie. These are top targets.
Age: 40+ year old Peerless bottlings are investment grade.
Octave Finish: The small quarter cask finish is niche but has fans.
Black Bull: The 30 and 40 year old blends are world-class.

faqs.question: What is 'The Octave'?
faqs.answer: Whisky finished in small (octave) casks for rapid wood interaction. Premium Octaves are valuable.

faqs.question: Do you buy Black Bull?
faqs.answer: Yes, specifically the high-age statement (30, 40) releases.

faqs.question: What is 'Rarest of the Rare'?
faqs.answer: A series dedicated to closed distilleries. We buy every bottle from this series.

faqs.question: Do you buy 'Battlehill'?
faqs.answer: Generally no, it is their entry-level supermarket line.

faqs.question: What is Tantalus?
faqs.answer: A luxury series using wood from the cask to make the bottle holder. Very collectible.

faqs.question: Is Duncan Taylor independent?
faqs.answer: Yes, based in Huntly. They are fiercely independent.
